channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of glass on road, 1st November
item.description:
There was an issue with a bin lorry on the corner of Ferris Road and Oakhurst Grove. There was loads of rubbish on the street which Southwark council cleared. However, loads and loads of small bits of glass were left on the road. Over time with cars driving over it the glass has been crushed leaving 1000s of tiny glass particles on the road. It's only really noticeable when it's dry and sunny and you can see all the glass shimmering. We have generally avoided going over it with our dog but occasionally forget. Last night for example when it was dark and the road surface was wet. This morning he has woken up with a limp and it looks like there is glass on his paw pad. We are concerned that without properly cleaning it up other dogs might be impacted. Especially if you're walking past and you don't know. Also if a small child were to fall over there could end up being a serious incident. It's been like that for about 10 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Oakhurst Grove, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Restaurant dumping food waste, 1st November
item.description:
I’m reporting repeated incidents of illegal commercial waste dumping by food trucks operating at 103 Union Street, London SE1 0LA. They have been regularly discarding meat waste, used oil cans, and other rubbish into the residential bins outside my property. We have had more rats, oil spills and rotten food smell from the waste that they are putting in the residential bins. This has caused overflowing bins, strong smells, and hygiene issues. As per the Environmental Protection Act 1990, commercial waste must not be disposed of in domestic bins, and this activity amounts to fly-tipping. I took these pictures this morning after the food truck guys dumped, it was between 3:30am and 4:30am. They filled the bin after it was emptied yesterday.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
